page.title: 18SPORT
page.content: There is a wide range of sports' facilities in Pudsey.Pudsey Park has public tennis courts and a crown bowling green.The largest playing field is Queen's Park (17 acres) with facilities for cricket,football and hockey.Private sports' clubs abound. Pudsey St.Lawrence C.C.,currently top of a very strong Bradford League,has helped to make Pudsey a cricket stronghold.Listed among famous Pudsey cricketers are John Tunnicliffe, Herbert Sutcliffe,Sir Leonard Hutton (364 v.Australia-Oval,1938) and Raymond Illingworth.Pudsey has its own cricket league,too.Among many local soccer clubs are Pudsey Juniors - our leading youth side.Both Rugby League and Union are played.There is a 9 hole golf course and two other golf courses at Woodhall.Pudsey Baths offers table tennis,swimming,keep-fit and pool.
